__e: Your book, Cradle and All, was a really important book for me.
Now I'm so terrified something will go wrong with Rose, I stand by her crib and watch her for hours. I...
I could just vomit into this crib, and there's a version here where you don't even have to be angry at me because I am so angry at myself right now.
She's upstairs sleeping in some dead kid's porta-crib.
And as soon as she had gone I went to the cot where my sister was lying and snatched the piece of bread she had.
I've seen some guy sitting at the baby bed and you don't care.
"The cradle of life," as he calls it.
It's just has never been seen since.
Trying to tell me it's not my right to move back into the cradle of my birth.
